Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds the rods and the disks as well as their respective position. Is the Model part of the MVC design.
    Author:
    Tom Langwaldt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Stack<Disk>> rods 
      private Settings settings 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates the model according to the passed settings.

      Gets the settings of the game.

    • Field Detail

      • settings

        private Settings settings

      • rods

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Stack<Disk>> rods

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameModel

        public GameModel(Settings settings)
        Creates the model according to the passed settings. Fills the first rod of the game with the amount of disks specified by the settings.
        Parameters:
        settings - Data passed via command line arguments.
        See Also:
        Settings

    • Method Detail

      • fillFirstRod

        private void fillFirstRod()
        Fills the first rod with disks, according to the settings passed to the constructor. Every disk gets a randomized color, on initiation.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the game data to its original state before any user interaction happened.

      • moveDisks

        public void moveDisks(java.util.Stack<Disk> originRod,
                      java.util.Stack<Disk> destiRod)
        Moves the top disk from one rod to another.
        Parameters:
        originRod - The rod from which the top most disk is to be removed from
        destiRod - The rod to which the disk is moved to

      • getSettings

        public Settings getSettings()
        Gets the settings of the game.
        Returns:
        settings Set by the command line arguments

      • getRods

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Stack<Disk>> getRods()
        Gets all the rods.
        Returns:
        A list of all the rods, starting with the leftmost one
